[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Cornell Repository System (CRS) defines technical and functional requirements for managing and sharing research materials.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CRS enables artifact upload, metadata curation, search, citation generation, and administrative workflows.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CRS integrates with library systems, metadata services, and indexing platforms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CRS provides web and mobile interfaces for artifact management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CRS operates on scalable cloud infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CRS ensures secure HTTPS-based data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CRS optimizes storage for large datasets and multimedia files.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CRS maintains 24/7 uptime with automated maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CRS supports multilingual metadata and localization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CRS links with academic repositories and citation indexing tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 MISSING-TAG2: CRS supports API integrations and metadata harvesting.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CRS relies on institutional network stability, metadata quality, and third-party APIs.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CRS serves faculty, researchers, and institutional staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CRS requires external database connectivity and cloud hosting services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Artifact: Digital content representing scholarly work.
Citation: Formatted reference for uploaded artifacts.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 MISSING-TAG1: CRS enables artifact upload, metadata management, and search.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable artifact uploads with customizable metadata fields (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support keyword, author, and title-based artifact searches (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall generate citations for uploaded artifacts in multiple formats (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall allow administrators to manage artifact access and embargo policies (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly, multilingual interface (REQ-DSGN-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store metadata in a scalable relational database.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall manage artifact files using distributed object storage.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process artifact uploads within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 10,000 concurrent users without performance degradation (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO/IEC 27001 for information security management.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR for data privacy and archival regulations.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt data at rest and in transit.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall provide usage analytics and access reports.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with library systems and metadata harvesters via REST APIs.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support Shibboleth authentication for secure access management.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Metadata schemas, system architecture, and workflow examples.
